text: Great solid head and nice dark brown body. Soft aroma of maple syrup and barley along with lots of sugar. Good sweet maple flavour but not too strong, crisp woody finish. Dry on the mouth surprisingly despite all the syrup. Good balance going on here.

Bottle pours dark chestnut brown with small layer of tan head. Nose and taste hve big rich nutty dark fruit, caramel, sticky maple, vanilla, dry oak, soft bourbon, medium sweetness, low carbonation, finishes with bourbon caramel raisin, touch of oxidation, dark fruits. The barrel does not impart a massive bourbon note but rather smooths and melds the flavors of the base beer nicely. Yum.

Apparence : Cuivrée, reflets rouges, tout de même lipide, pratiquement aucun col brunâtre, effervescence moyenne et plutôt lente. 
Nez : Caramel grillé, boisé et alcool en entrée. Rapidement, le nez shabitue et laisse dévoiler les arômes de fruits séchés tels les dattes, tout en conservant les autres aspects en seconde vague. Intensité élevée. 
Goût : Riche caramel grillé soutenu par une présence alcoolisée non négligeable, mais très intéressante, sucrée, dattes bien évidentes. Amertume modérée en finale avec une touche boisée, voire un peu plus sèche que le corps. Très intense. 
Sensation : Effervescence plutôt élevée, chaleur partout en bouche, corps plein, finale avec une petite amertume et un peu sèche de bonne longueur. 
O : Un dessert alcoolisé en bouteille! Sucrée, alcoolisée, fruits séchés, intense, bon corps quoi demander de plus dune Scotch Ale?
Bottle. Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are sweet maple, caramel, and molasses.

Colore ambra scuro, schiuma di buona persistenza beige compatta. Al naso davvero buono laroma di sciroppo dacero e caramello. Palato molto intenso dolce con malto, caramello, sciroppo dacero, vaniglia e una bella nota alcolica. Carbonazione media, corpo medio e cremosa. Davvero top.

5/V/16 - 33cl bottle from a trade @ home - bottled: XII/2014 (2016-509) Thanks to YouriLévesque for the trade!
Clear brown to red brown beer, irregular creamy beige head, unstable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: sweet, lots of caramel, vanilla, more caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: lots of alcohol noticeable, bourbon, sweet, some banana, more vanilla. Aftertaste: alcohol and more alcohol, ripe banana, dried fruits, bitter touch, caramel.
Bottle from tderoeck. Many thanks! Dark brown colour, fruity nose (dark fruit), malty, vanilla bourbon. Sweet, very light bitter. Good scotch.
Bottle at tderoeck's place, thanks! Better than the original but still not my style, some vanilla, caramel, meh,

Bouteille 341 mL, version 2014

Couleur : Couleur brunâtre, très peu de carbonatation, mais une intéressante effervescence, pour une bière vieillie.

Arômes : Nez complexe. Quelques mots de même : Caramel. Vanille. Érable. Toffee. Alcool. Bois. Cest prometteur.

Goût : Bouche pas aussi complexe que le nez. On goûte énormément la vanille et le bois. On perd, en quelque sorte, lérable, assez discret dans la version standard de lÉquinoxe. Petite finale touchant ce quon sattend dune scotch ale : caramel, toffee.

Appréciation : On retrouve lérable finalement en fin de bouteille. Cest très bon, peut-être un peu trop barriqué. Intéressant de comparer loriginale et la version vieillie pour bien comprendre les différences entre les deux brassins. Pour ceux déjà partiaux à loriginale, la version chêne saura vous charmer à nouveau.
12oz bottle of 2014 bourbon barrel aged. Pours a reddy brown color with a bit of head. Rich bourbon and malt flavors. Spice balances well.

Bottle from Steve. Pours a hazy brownish red with a thin off white head. Aroma is bourbon and maple with some woodsy dark fruit notes. Medium malt body with bourbon, roasted grain, maple syrup and earthy hop notes. Complex and really good.

Alcool fort assez présent au nez, on sattend à quelque chose de corsé. Lérable tarde à se pointer la face au nez, mais en bouche cest une autre histoire! Lérable est bien présent et est absolument déletable! Je ne suis pas un fan fini de bieres sucrées, de scotch ale en particulier, mais quand cest réussi comme ici, difficile de résister! Les bières vieillies de Dieu Du Ciel sont vraiment une coche au dessus de pas mal tout ce qui se fait dautre au Québec.

Bottle from ddc release A: bourbon, plums, caramel, raisins, red fruits, dates alcohol app: murky brown small beige head t/p: full body with sweet and medium long finish. Soft carbonation. O: a nice touch is added from this barrel aging the bourbon play nicely the complexity already present in the original brew. Alcohol is a tad too present.

[2014] 341ml bottle. Murky brown with a foamy beige head. Flavors are roasted cereals, peat malt, tobacco, molasses, vanilla, maple syrup, burnt caramel, alcohol and bourbon with salty notes. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

2014 Bottle from Marché Village. Aroma: strong aroma of bourbon, candied fruits, spices, woody. App: hazy dark burgundy, murky, medium tan  head, little retention but still has some lacing. Taste and palate: medium to full body, medium sweetness, a hint of maple in mouth, really subtle bitter and alcohol finish but this is way more sweet than bitter. Overall: good warming beer. Quite complex. Like the woody love given by the barrel. Quite sweet but this is nothing unusual for this kind of beer.

Aroma is sweet from maple syrup, plums and hints of vanilla. Taste is awesome sweet toffee, sticky raisins and figs, low bitterness and pure decadence. You almost get diabetes from this one by just looking at it. Never the less, its an awesome winter warmer
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2015 Smells like coffee and a bit of malt. Taste is raisins and weird sort of malty notes. Medium to thick body with some booziness.  Basically no carbonation and smooth.
bottle into a tulip. Pours a deep brown, with a moderate off-white head that quickly fades. Nose is caramel and maple, and the taste follows the nose, with a short hop finish. Nice.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Bottled with a small, brief head. 
Vinous , acidic aroma with vinegar. 
Sweet and perfumeish flavour. Heavily vinous and rather alcoholic. 
Sweet fruits; figs, plums.

Bottle [from IP trade with Yourilevesque] @ weekly tasting shared with Joes and Judyvv. Nice dark red, red-brown color, average sized off-white to beige head. Aroma is malts, sweetish, oak. Taste malts, oak, wood, bourbon, sweetish, a hint of caramel, softly bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is bourbon, raisins, dates, caramel, fig, maple, prunes. Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel, rich and sweet on the palate with a fruity finish. Hides the booze well. Taste is raisins, bourbon, maple syrup, dates, figs, caramel, prunes. Delicious.
Brown pour. Nose is ashy, bourbon, caramel. Taste is incredibly sweet. Medium mouthfeel.

Couleur brune opaque avec un mince col beige assez résistant. Aromes complexes, de sirop dérable,caramel, notes boisé, alcool,vanille,fruits rouges,noix. Très bonne Scotch Ale, une des meilleure. A reboire!

Liquide dun brun caramel très opaque aux timides reflets rubis. Le liquide a la couleur de la tire dérable (heureusement pas la densité!). Faible mousse lors du service mais celle-ci séclipse très rapidement. Je crois quen présence dune bière de ce type, il ne faut pas sattendre à une mousse généreuse alors cet aspect nest absolument pas décevant pour moi. Au nez, le doux parfum de lérable nous rappelle que lhiver tire (sans jeu de mots) à sa fin! Ça sent la nature qui reprend vie, leau dérable et le bois. Ce nez memmène à rêver à un feu de foyer dans une cabane où lon sert une traditionnelle tarte au pacanes. Sublime nez! Lalcool est également présente mais cest bon: tout est parfaitement cohérent et harmonieux. Avec un tel nez, on ne peut que machinalement conduire le verre au bord des lèvres et attaquer dune lampée enthousiaste! En bouche, le liquide est dune rondeur parfaite; cest soyeux, liquoreux, généreux, chaud... quel mouthfeel divin! Les saveurs sont celles anticipées, auxquelles sajoutent avec force les flaveurs du fût de bourbon qui ajoutent, il faut le mentionner, une légère acidité au centre de la langue contrôlant ainsi le sucre avant que celui-ci ne semballe complètement . Pour tout amateur de scotch ale (que je ne suis habituellement pas), cette bière sublimissime est un incontournable absolu. Elle se déguste parfaitement en accompagnement dun dessert, tels une tarte aux poires ou aux pacanes (je me répète je sais). Personnellement, jéviterais de faire concept avec un dessert à lérable - la bière sen charge!

Dark brown with a tiny brownish head. Lots of bourbon notes, vanilla, maple and a little Scottish caramel. Sweet taste, nearly no bitterness with some acidity. Full body with a slick texture and an soft carbonation. Caramel finish.

Couleur du caramel riche avec un petit col beige. Larôme est plein du bourbon avec du caramel et un peu dérable. Le goût est dabord du caramel sucré, puis du bourbon, vanille, et scotch avec un peu dérable dans la finale. Ce nest pas trop sucré, et laprès goût a une bonne chaleur dalcool.

Bottle @ THT January. Side by side with the non barrel aged version. Pours a murky brownish beer with a very small beige head on top, almost headless. Aroma has loads of bourbon, malts and a hint of vanilla. Flavor is very sweet with loads of bourbon upfront, but the licorice from the base beer is still there. Good in balance with a sweet aftertaste. Good stuff!

Bottle shared at Deans off for his annual haircut tasting thanks to JulienHuxley. Pours murky brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of big bourbon/vanilla upfront with woody barrel notes, maple and overripe dark fruit. Flavour is heavy sweet. Near full bodied with very soft carbonation.

Bottle @THT Jan 2015 courtesy of and shared with JulienHuxley
Very thin tan hed. Hazy deep amber pour. Nice complex maple syrup and barrel notes. Very good.

Thanks for this Thomas! Murky rusty chestnut brown with a decent off white head. Aroma of vanilla, rich bourbon, oak. Taste is not super barrel heavy, but some vanilla, lots of sweet rich malt, but very easily drinkable.

** Bouteille 2011 (Merci Marheb) **

Une mousse quasi invisible se sauve rapidement dun liquide brun foncé aux reflets acajou discrets. Des émanations puissantes de bois imbibé dalcool fort enterrent une présence légère de fruits confits. En bouche, cest du gros sucre dérable alcoolisé ... jai eu limage des grands-pères dans le sirop suivis dun shooter de whiskey. La très faible carbonatation contribue à émanciper cette forte présence alcoolisée qui se termine dans une touche boisée. Malgré son âge, elle était en grande forme.
Nice strange beer with the maple coming through in the aftertaste. Quite astringent in a strange way since it is very sweet.

From tap at BierCab, Barcelona. Listed as "Dieu du Ciel Equinoxe du Printemps Barrel Aged Scotch Ale". Red amber clear color with small off-white head. Aroma is caramel and wood, some vanilla and light fruity. Taste is sweet, mostly caramel and light woody alcoholic. Medium oily body, soft carbonation, light bitter finish.
On tap at Biercab. Dark brown colour with tan head. Chocolate, wood and vanilla aroma. Sweet, chocolate, vanilla and wood taste, some alcohol. Medium to full body.

Tap. Pours a bit hazy deep amber with fine tan head. Aroma is loats of dried fruits, berries and brown sugar. Some toasted malts and vanilla. And the a kind of sweet licourish booze. Complex though. Taste is heavy sweet, dates, some toasted wood. Really creamy body. Boozy warming finish.
Nice combination of dark fruits, vanilla, light spice and slight smoke. Feel is a touch boozy, in part due to the low carbonation. Warming with a lasting sweet finish. Good stuff."

En fût. Verre de 6 oz dégusté au Siboire (Sherbrooke, QC) lors de la Soirée des Grand Crus 2014 au coût de 4,50$. Arôme: Odeur de vanille avec une pointe de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est brune. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de vanillee et dérable avec une pointe sucrée. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de vanille en arrière goût. (Rating #5630)

Wow. Thanks alehunter aka Dominic! Pours a beautiful murky chestnut brown with very little head. Aromas of strong vanilla and caramel. A touch of funk and bourbon too. This is not too sweet at all. Just a beautifully balanced beer. Sweet vanilla and caramel with enough boozy warmth to keep it balanced. One of the great beers Ive had the pleasure of trying.

A 2009 vintage bottle. Pours a beautiful dark burgundy with a foamy beige head that fizzles away quickly. The nose is rich and sweet with tons of woody barrel notes, light funky earthen notes. Lots of toffee and butterscotch flavours up front with a light sweet maple and scotch note. Big barrel notes towards the finish with a pinch of funk. A nice cellared flavour profile with a lingering aftertaste and tons of rich malts and dark dried fruits.

Bottle with thanks to Sebastien! Pour is murky mahogany with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma is a bit of apple, bourbon, dark sugars, toffee. Flavor is medium sweet, light bourbon influence, lots of malty sugars. Medium body. Certainly decent, but not earth shattering.
Bottle - Sweet whisky notes and lots of oak. Jet brown with a thin beige head. Oak notes dominate, but in a nice way. The whisky notes and malts round this out, I am very happy.

Bouteille 341ml, 2013. Couleur brune très foncé presque opaque, mousse beige sale. Arôme de bourbon, boisé, caramel, sucre dérable. Goût de malt légèrement torréfié, bourbon léger, sucré, sucre brûlé en fin de bouche, tire dérable en arrière-goût. Carbonation moyenne, corps moyen-dense. Une autre belle réalisation de DDC!

Brown pour with a baby finger of head. Aroma of bourbon on the rocks, vanilla, wood. Taste...somewhere between bourbon and scotch giving was to vanilla, slight maple, anise, yeast, caramel, raisin. Nice.

2011 vinatge. Pour is dark brown with a thin beige head and little lacing. Aroma of bourbon, caramel, vanilla, light anise. Taste is sweet with bourbon, vanilla, caramel, dried fruits, oak, booze. Full body, a bit over-carbonated for the style. Very good sipper.

Caramel brown with decent, creamy, tan head, light lacing / Mild nose of caramel, dark fruit, pine / Medium to full body, somewhat thin, chewy, sweet, good balance with bitter finish, and light alcohol burn / Flavors of caramel, milk chocolate, cream, date, fig / Seemingly well-meaning, with solid flavors, but somewhat thin, hot, body deflate the result.

Aroma: Brown sugar and almond
Appearance Copper brown with creamy beige head
Taste: Im getting the maple and its coming through as burnt caramel. Surprisingly yeasty for a scotch ale.
Overview: Not as malty as a typical scotch ale as mind blowingly good as Dieu due Ciel Aphrodite but still enjoyable

Bottle [341ml] c/o Glouglouburp. Pours a very murky , dark amber-brown with cool sediment formations and an average size diminishing fizzy tan head. Lovely aroma of bourbon, wood, caramel malt, some maple, vanilla, dark fruit and more. Flavour: Wow thats good! (8+) Sweet and malty with a perfect amount of bourbon barrel-ageing, not overdone, along with some maple syrup and dark fruit. Alcohol is very well hidden considering the abv. Medium to full bodied, sticky mouthfeel. Awesome stuff, I knew this would be good but not this good.

Slovak you devil thank you for this! Brown maple pour, the aroma is fantastic, sweet hints of vanilla, oak, smoke and boozy bourbon. The taste does not quite live up to how good it smells, the bourbon doesnt shine through as much as I though it would which isnt necessarily a bad thing as it does not over power the taste, that being said it doesnt really bump up the complexity as much as I thought it would given how good it smells. Taste is very oaky, not overly rich, with subtle hint of bourbon and very clean woody finish. Good overall.
Trade from Quebec.  Very good scotch ale here, a style Im not usually that fond of.  The maple syrup and barrel aging do this wonders.  Aromas a strong.

Bière couleur de noisette, plutôt opaque et coiffée dun fine écume laissant au verre une légère dentelle.  Des arômes complexes et boisés de noix, dérable et de xérès.  Elle est bien amère, avec un peu de sucre résiduel.  Elle est liquoreuse, de corps robuste, finement effervescente et se termine sur une très longue finale aromatique.

Pours dark brown with a nondescript head. Aroma is bourbon and molasse. Taste is sweet with a hint of acidity (from the barrel?) to balance it out. Flavors are once again bourbon derived: salted caramel, wood, almost buttery. Mouthfeel is good and full with maybe a touch too much carbonation at first (but it settles down after a while). Alcohol is felt but well integrated. A really nice sipper, one that I will seek out again in the future!
Thanks to tommy for this bottle.  Nice toasty vanilla with raisins and nuts.  The bourbon is prominant and nicely balanced.  Great stuff.
Rich brown pour, tan head.  Flavors are really wonderful.  Rich bourbon notes, toffee, maple, vanilla, golden raisins.  So smooth and so tasty.
Thanks to tommy, fantastic stuff, the maple sweetness complements the bourbon barrel and scotch ale perfectly. Fantastic stuff, love it

Bouteille 341ml (version 2012, vieillie 1 an en fût de bourbon). De couleur brune foncée et voilée. Nez malté de caramel toffee aux notes rôties, moyennement boisé (fût de chêne), léger de sirop dérable avec des notes dalcool, de vanille et de sucre brun ainsi quavec quelques traces fruitées et épicées. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement doux-moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement huileuse. Léger goût de vanille avec un léger goût épicé (surtout poivrées) ainsi que des traces de fumée de bois et de fruits foncés lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de caramel aux notes rôties, léger de biscuits au sirop dérable avec des notes de sucre brun. Parallèlement, lon retrouve un léger goût dalcool boisé (fût de chêne faiblement liquoreux) aux petites notes réchauffantes jusquen finale. Post-goût plutôt long et un peu sec, légèrement amer dalcool boisé avec des notes épicées ainsi que de faibles traces de fumée de bois et dérable.

Bottle 341ml.
Pours dark brown with low beige head. Aroma is of bourbon, malt, alcohol, fruits, maple syrup. Taste is of bourbon, malt, alcohol, caramel, sweetness, fruits, maple syrup. Palate: Medium body. Overall: Very good. Easy to drink, not cloying. Bourbon (and alcohol) is bold, but it does the trick. Solid.

Bière brune trouble avec des reflets... euh... bruns troubles. Nez dalcool, de vin rouge, de crème brûlée et de pain doré. En bouche, les saveurs que laissaient anticiper les arômes explosent avec une touche dérable en trame de fond. Le boisé nous suit aussi, en finesse, du début à la fin. La rencontre dune grande bière et dun baril de chêne qui se sentait un peu seul; du grand art!

Bottle (341 ml). Murky brown with a small beige head and barely no lacing. Aroma of bourbon, maple syrup, caramel, vanilla and oak. Taste is moderately sweet with strong bourbon and wood notes, maple syrup,  vanilla and alcohol. Slight acidic finish. Mouthfeel is dry and warming. Some carbonation. The base beer is very good, but this is a very nice variation. Well done BA Scotch Ale!

341 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with a ruby red tint and a resilient beige head. Smell is maple and vanilla. Taste is woody, loads of heavy caramel, vanilla, bourbon and brown sugar. Finish has very little bitterness - a touch of herbs, thats it. Lingering oak and vanilla flavors. Medium to strong body. A superb, solid scotch ale.

Thx to Mike for not taking advantage of my supple bottom in that dark alley. Oh, yea, and for the wonderful brew. THe pour sounded the the beer was applauding me for opening it. Big fizz up and an instant death and Im left with this murky thing in my glass - bit of sediment snuck in my glass like a hook worm does in your foot. cool aroma - marzipan, some maple coating the barrel stuff and the oak, mocha minus most of the coffee character, some generic Speyside scotch, marshmallows, roasted malts, some sweetness, almonds, creamy butter, alcohol. Yea, that pretty much is all one needs in a glass. Time for a power drinkin as the popcorn oil is a blazin yo. Smooth and almost waxy on the lips and mouth parts that are within my mouth part. Not as complex - and some tongue numbing. Alcohol sweetness and zip on the finish - its actually pretty easy to simply concentrate on that alone if you have trained your mind for such a thing. Vanilla, extra sweetness, toffee, molasses, brown sugar, etc. Some scotchiness, maple.... not quite a sipper but my tastebuds are having a pretty easy time not really paying attention. I like it for sure and the maple is a good touch but this smells alot better than it tastes - not that it tastes bad what so ever. Maybe this just wasnt my night for this. Still tasty though. In fact, I just came back after 10 minutes away and its better than I recall. I think I ended up power drinking most of it and didnt give it the fair shake it needed. Im going to go and eat popcorn that has half a stick of butter on it. That fixes any problem.

In short: A rich malty brown beer with well integrated maple and bourbon barrels.  Very good dessert beer.
How: Tap at brewpub.
The look: Cloudy brown body topped by a persistent small beige head.
In long: Nose has a medium bourbon presence that is pretty harmonious with the pleasant pure maple syrup aroma.  Taste starts with an attack of toffee and maple syrup and then a moderate bourbon barrel flavor joins in and then ends with a woody finish that partially washes some of the sweetness away.  Really full body with plenty of big soft bubbles, very nice mouthfeel.  No alcohol presence whatsoever.  This was radically different from the first batch that was released two years ago and that was very hot boozy and brutally boubonny.  Either this was a new batch or aging did wonders on this one.  Another year, another DDC anniversary party, I got drunk, started acting like an asshole, started seeing double, people giving me the middle finger looking like they are sending me a peace sign cool dude.

341ml bottle, reserve 2011, dark brown color, with a small tan head, nice grated coconut, vanilla, fruitcake, bourbonish nose, with some mild barley sugar, toasted, caramel, wheat, biscuity malty notes, with a light maple syrup, sponge toffee, bran muffin, dried raisin, prune, maple sugar accents in the aroma follows through on a full-bodied palate with a warmth, yeasty, fruitcake, light maple syrup, strong bourbon barrel, phenolic boozy character, with some brown sugar, barley sugar, toasted, caramelized, biscuity, wheat malt, toffee, cookie dough flavours, with a fruity dried raisin, fig, sugar pie, raisin pie, vanilla undertone, leading towards a warming, sweet maple sugar, dried fruit, coconut bourbon liquorish finish.
Nez très boisé, épicé dérable et de bourbon. En bouche, beaucoup deffervescence mais avec un peu de repos la texture se place et la vanille sexprime. Buvabilité très faible.

Drank on tap (8 oz) at Dieu du Ciels 14th anniversary party, on September 15, 2012. Muddy dark brown, small head. Aroma hops maple, a little fruity. Taste of bourbon in conflict with maple, sweet alccol, aftertaste of sweet alcohol. Maple and bourbon are not a good combination!Earlier Rating: 9/13/2010 Total Score: 3.8341 ml bottle drank at there 12th anniversary party, September 11, 2010. Dark hazel brown, thin head. Alcoholic maple aroma, malted barley sweetness. Taste of dry maple liqueur, notes of malted scotch, a very warming finish. This oak aged version realy bring out the maple!

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 Bouteille 341 ml. 9,5%. Réserve 2009. Couleur brune un peu opaque, mousse beige. Nez de chêne, de sucre dérable et de malt. En bouche, beaucoup beaucoup de chêne...il manque un peu déquilibre daprès moi. Excellente beer, un peu trop de chêne mais ça réchauffe, et ça séquilibre. Cest bon.

341 ml bottle generously gifted by Glouglouburp as an extra in our trade. Many many thanks man! Pours hazy dark amberish wooden brown with a small deep golden head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace. Smell is very sweet with maple syrup, dark bread, roasted coconuts, dry wood, overripe plums, toffee, alcohol, dark honey, roasted cereal, vanilla fudge, charred wood and hints of citrus. Taste is very sweet, tiny bitter and malty with caramel, maple syrup, alcohol, plums and raisins in brandy, fresh grass, charred wood, roasted coconut, alcohol, resinous wood and hints of smoke and citrus zest. Mouthfeel is intense, round, sticky sweet, tiny boozy and full bodied. Finish is sweet and very tiny bitter with sweet dark bread, maple syrup, caramel, citrus zest, charred wood, roasted coconut, alcohol and hints of roasted cereals. I can see people finding this too sweet but I very much like the combination of maple syrup and classical oak aged characteristics.

(Bottle) Pours dark brown with red/orange highlight. Small head. The flavour holds caramel, maple syrup, caramelized nuts, wood, butter, vanilla and a touch of dried fruits. Bit numbing from the warming alcohol. The flavour is medium to heavily sweet, light to medium bitter and tiny acidic with notes of caramel, syrup, wood, alcohol and some fruit. The mouthfeel is fiery, round and sticky with a medium fizzy carbonation. Sticky syrup finish with a touch of hops. Medium bodied.

Bottle at Mumsig Miniprovning, Göteborg. Somewhat hazy copper/amber beer, small beige head. Figs aroma, sweetish, dades, plums, syrup, oak, woody, toffee, biscuits, some alcohol. Malty raisins flavor, figs, alcohol, toffee, banana notes, vinous, caramel, oak notes, vanilla. Sweet and with evident alcohol. Finish with smoked notes, figs, dades and caramel.

Bottle @ MMP. Pours cloudy deep dark amber wirh a nic beige head. Aroma is sweet fruity prunes malty marzipan a bit boozy. Flavor is sweet malty fruity a bit pungent bitter raisins almonds nutty. Finishes nutty bitter sweet and malty.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 bourbon-aged. on tap at festibiere quebec, qc. murky dark brown with a very nice beige head, very good retention, nice lacing. tons of complex caramels combined with oaky-bourbony notes, light smoky notes, maple - sweet. average to soft carbonation, medium to full body, abv very will hidden. sweet and awesomely good!

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours murky brown with an off white head. Aroma of maple syrup, acetone, marzipan, booze, caramel, roasted malts and wood. Flavour virtually as expected from the aroma. It is softly carbonated yet a smooth mouthfeel. Full bodied, sweet, but a bit too boozy for my taste right now.

11.5oz. Bottle:  Aroma of malt, scotch, slight marzipan, burnt toffee, and a hint of maple syrup.  Poured a dark brown/deep orange in color with a large, creamy, dense, tan/light brown head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy/hazy.  Sparkling.  Flavor is medium sweet.  Tastes of malt, Scotch, burnt toffee, wood, and a hint of maple syrup.  Medium body.  Average texture.  Medium sweet, malt, Scotch, burnt toffee, wood finish.  9.5%ABV is completely hidden throughout.
Bottle thanks to Dany. Pours darkest brown. Nose/taste of bourbon barrel, oak, maple syrup, vanilla, sweet malt and dark candi sugar. Medium body.
Une bonne odeur de banane. Une belle mousse qui sestombe rapidement. Un goût de velour, du stock et dalcool, avec un peu damertume.

Sampled at the Irish Hanukkah Tasting. Murky brown pour, no chunks, ring of tan head. Sweet maple syrup and alcohol nose. Great warming sensations and sweet maple and vanilla and scotch notes.  Really enjoyable.

Bottle shared by Drake at the Irish Chanukah tasting.  Pours cloudy brown with virtually no head.  Aroma is maple, plums, dates, caramel and cookie malt, wood notes and light vanilla.  Flavor is malt dominant, vanilla, maple, oak, light hops and bitterness with a sweet palate yet dry finish.  Full body, medium warmth and carbonation.

12 ounce bottle courtesy of Julienhuxley and shared at the Baltimore Irish Chanukah tasting, 3/17/12. Pours a murky brown color with a thin fizzy head. Below average head retention. Aroma of toffee, whisky, maple, earthy notes. The taste is toffee, raisin, leafy hops. burnt sugar, vanilla. Medium-full bodied with a bit of heat. Nice beer.
Thanks to Glouglouburb.  Dany is the man!  Great aroma.  Strong malt backbone.  Great beer, even if it comes from French Canada.

341mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany!), split with Matts_Property, pours an opaque dark orangy brown with a small beige head. Aroma of loads of maple syrup, scotch whiskey, brown sugar, heaps of caramel, molasses and quite high alcohol. Flavour of maple syrup and booze upfront, with brown sugar, subtle scotch whiskey, molasses, caramel and slight oak (though quite subdued / subtle). Boozier than I remember the original, with subtle use of the oak barrels. Very complex and the sweetness is balanced well, unlike many scotch ales. Delicious.

Bottle shared by the Michigan crew, thanks! Poured a cloudy deep amber with a white head that dissipated to the edges. Aroma had a bit of booze on it but had sweet grains, with some maple and a bit of backing caramel and toffee. Flavor starts with maple and sweet grains with some caramel and toffee in the finish.

Bottle at a Max tasting. Pours a hazy, muddy tan with creamy khaki lacing. Awesome aroma of butterscotch, oak, bourbon, and some hay needles. Flavor is heavy of high-quality bourbon (my criteria being "tastes good") with some sweet butterscotch and a mild oakiness. Powerful flavor yet balanced. Caramel stickiness and oak in the finish. Delicious and damn drinkable.

Bottle at Maxs impromptu tasting.  Pours a murky brown with a thin beige head.  Bourbon like crazy.  Wood and sweet vanilla.  Sweet with big carbonation, warm bourbon, phenols and yeast.  Toasty and warm on the finish.

Bottle: Poured a deep dirty brown color ale with a super large foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma of wood notes with nice caramelized sugar and light maple notes as well. Taste is quite complex with nice wooden notes which are well balanced with some caramelized sugar notes and some light maple sugar ester. Body was quite full with great carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Very pleasantly surprised by this one with a lot more complexity then in the regular version but also drinks very easily. Very nice example of how to use oak to increase flavour profile of beer.

Bouteille de 341ml. Édition 2009 (Merci Pat.) Brune mousse beige peu durable, grosses bulles, le pchoutt était puissant.  Le nez est complexe avec des arômes dérable, de vin rouge, de bois, de chêne.  La bouche est mordante, lalcool fort, elle se compose dun mélange de bois et dérable, danis ou réglisse noire. La sucrosité est moins marqué que dans version normale. Il y a une touche fumée en bouche. Cest une scotch ale qui ressemble presquà un whiskey ou à un amontillado. Le goût est très persistant laissant les saveurs marquées le palais pour de longues minutes. Une demi-bouteille suffit.

Bottle shared by Fred, thanks man.  Pours a malty bruin body with an off white head and some light retention.  Aromatically maple and sweet with a modest amount of etoh latent fruit shining through.  A hint of caramel and wisp of smoke, malty sweet with a big bourbon like warmth to finish.  Not bad.

Barleywine period. Rich malt and the maple syrup in the aroma.  Looks a little unfiltered.  Average mouthfeel, however.  A little oak as well which helps bring out the complexity.Smooth, and the scotch style resonates it seems more in Quebec than anywhere else in North America.Thanks for picking up Lubiere.

(Édition 2009, courtoisie de JulienHuxley)  Le liquide dévoile une robe brune foncée.  La tête mousseuse se retire très rapidement.  Le nez est malté, enveloppé de tire dérable, piqué par un bourbon chaud et chatouillé par des effluves vanillés.  Le goût est riche dun érable et dun caramel qui se font définitivement réchauffer par des saveurs qui suintent le fût de chêne.  Un heureux mélange dans lequel le bourbon saffirme avec détermination.  En bouche, le liquide a une rondeur agréable.  Le pétillement est modéré et la texture huileuse.  La finale se fait sur des notes maltées braisées par un alcool piquant et parfumé.

341 ml bottle from GRM (merci!), served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Deep hazy mahogany with a frail light tan head.
  
Aroma:  Lots of smoky Bourbon-Scotch notes, gobs of dark dried fruit behind that, some esters, brown sugar and caramel, sweet, more Bourbon, maybe a little too much for my nose, a touch of alcohol, some brighter fruit notes, a hint of yeast.
  
Palate:  Medium body, fairly lively, prickly effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Lots of dark dried fruits, brighter fruits, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, plenty of wood...again mainly Bourbon and whiskey with some smoke, some alcohol, esters; sweet with restrained bitterness and a long, fruity and very alcoholic finish.

The barrel-ageing doesnt improve the overall experience for me.  Still an interesting brew and glad to have the opportunity to try it.

Im a fan of bourbon, and this just hits my good spot. Pours a hazy october brown with minimal head. Boozy honeyed aroma. Sweet caramel with a hint of the maple. Little carbonation makes the sweetness quite heavy, but it is still very easy for me to love.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2011 Brown bottle, 341 ml, purchased at the St-Jérôme microbrewery, drank in a Dieu du Ciel! glass, savoured on February 20 2011; eye: dirty brown with cherry hue, clear, nice effervescence, tiny sheet of beige head, no lacing; nose: oak, flambéed caramel, brandy, alcohol warmth, spices, brown sugar; mouth: oak, brandy, alcohol warmth, spices, flambéed caramel, brown sugar, concentrated maple syrup, finale in brandy with presence of spices, full body, good carbonation, lightly sweet, lightly vinous texture; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 341 ml, achetée à la microbrasserie (St-Jérôme), bue dans un verre Dieu du ciel!, savourée le 20 février 2011; il : brun sale avec des reflets cerise, claire, bonne effervescence, petite couverture de mousse beige, pas de dentelle; nez : chêne, caramel flambé, brandy, chaleur dalcool, épices, cassonade; bouche : chêne, brandy, chaleur dalcool, épices, caramel flambé, cassonade, malt, sirop dérable concentré, finale en brandy avec présence dépices, corsée, bonne carbonatation, légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement vineuse; en résumé : bien bon
Bottle. A boozy godess. Dark tea colour with way too much foam and head. Flavour is thick sticky caramel with a light smokiness. A bit thin and disjointed with some intereting peaks.
Dark hazy amber with a small beige head. Aroma is wood, bourbon, caramel, chocolate. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. In mouth it maple, caramel, chocolate, oak (mostly at the end).
huge bourbon nose with lots of chocolate and cherries. Very rich cherry cola. Massively bourbony but so well integrated. Boozy. Lingering cherry chocolatey finish.

Had this wee beastie last night (Jan. 25th-Robert Burns b-day night). Colour... dark amber-brown with no head. Nose... eminently sweet with maple and butterscotch. Palate... an echo of the nose with that richly maple-like sweetness and overtones of honey, booze, toffee, treacle sirop and Christmas cake. I do believe Bobbie Burns wouldve approved of this one, for afters!

Bottle.  Im really not a huge fan of scotch ales, and not much of the regular version of this beer but the barrel aging has a tremendous effect on that beer.  Obvious notes of maple taffee in the taste but the bourbon notes are much prevalent over anything else.  Notes of dried fruits and vanilla, with a quite intense leafy hoppiness also present.  A lot of alchool.  Long aftertaste with the bourbon notes persisting.  Pretty orgasmic to my tastebuds...

Bottle. Hazy amber with a medium beige head with good retention. Aroma is maple syrup, wood, scotch, dark malt, plums and alcohol. Flavor is caramel, maple syrup, wood dark fruits and a lot of warm alcohol. Full body.

A reddish brown ale with a thick big bubbled moka head. In aroma, a smooth caramel butterscotch overlayed with oaken notes, vanilla, quite nice. In mouth, a smooth sweet candy sugar with warming alcohol, wooden notes, a bit of licorice, complex and smooth.  Bottle at brewery, Dec. 27 2010.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2012 341ml bottle from DDC. 2009 vintage.
Appearance : Slightly muddy amber with small head.

Aroma : Light oxidation with maple syrup. Light wood. Some alcohol too. 

Taste : Nice sweet maple syrup with light oxidation and wood. Nice woody finish with maple syrup. Light hops. Light alcohol, slightly warming. Spicy finish.

Overall : Nice sweetness mixed with wood. Interesting oxidation but still a bit too much alcohol. Nice sugary nose. Still not a big fan of this. The alcohol didnt mellowed much so Im a bit disappointed. Rating stays the same.

341ml bottle at DDC anniversary.

Appearance : Hazy deep brown with a little head.

Aroma : Lots of barrel (probably bourbon). Notes of vanilla. Nice sugary sweetness, nice maple syrup. Nice bourbon.

Taste : Nice sugary maple syrup with bourbon. Very hot, lots of alcohol. Woody and oaky on finish. Very warm finish with lots of bourbon. Quite dry. Soft carbonation.

Overall : Very interesting experiment. Nice sugary maple syrup. Interesting bourbon but maybe a bit too much. Too much alcohol on taste. September 30th 2010. 8,3,7,3,15;3.6

2009 bottle at the brewpub. dark brown with a tan head, this barrel aged version is quite different than its standard counterpart. the wood really comes out, as does the maple. the alcohol leaves a nice burn, this beer is so amazing.

Bottle 2009 at the brewpub. Murky brown with some yellowish head. The barrel aging really brought out the maple aroma of this beer, mixed with lots of spicy, vanilla oak notes. Taste is sweet maple flavor, lots of wood and a strong alcohol finish. Palate was hot and velvety like a good spirit, a very nice beer.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2016 My Bottom Line:
This bourbon-laced Scotch Ale is able to accentuate the maple flavors with its vanilla-like spicy sweetness, leading to an alcohol splash, wooden dryness and candied berries.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam circles the dark brown with coppery highlights.
-The flavor profile is a marvel of ingredient harmony.
-The light hop presence in the finish works perfectly with the wooden barrel and alcohol flames.
-The prickly but soft bubbling helps drinkability, but this remains a fiery sipper.
-This is an accomplished brew, but it may be too linear overall for me to call it "excellent" (when released). Age it a year and the barrel presence relaxes a bit and flavors become even more integrated.

Bottles.
